00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to PCIe as a host(RC) or target(EP)
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 148290 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_PCIE_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_PCIE_H__
00050 
00051 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00052 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00053 extern "C" {
00054 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00058 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx.h>
00059 #elif defined(__U_BOOT__)
00060 #include <asm/arch/cvmx.h>
00061 #else
00062 #include <cvmx.h>
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #define CVMX_PCIE_MAX_PORTS 4
00066 #define CVMX_PCIE_PORTS     ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX)    \
00067                   || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX))    \
00068                  ? CVMX_PCIE_MAX_PORTS          \
00069                  : (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX) ? 3 : 2))
00070 
00071 /*
00072  * The physical memory base mapped by BAR1.  256MB at the end of the
00073  * first 4GB.
00074  */
00075 #define CVMX_PCIE_BAR1_PHYS_BASE ((1ull << 32) - (1ull << 28))
00076 #define CVMX_PCIE_BAR1_PHYS_SIZE (1ull << 28)
00077 
00078 /*
00079  * The RC base of BAR1.  gen1 has a 39-bit BAR2, gen2 has 41-bit BAR2,
00080  * place BAR1 so it is the same for both.
00081  */
00082 #define CVMX_PCIE_BAR1_RC_BASE (1ull << 41)
00083 
00084 typedef union {
00085     uint64_t u64;
00086 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD    /* A Linux compatible proxy for __BIG_ENDIAN */
00087     struct {
00088         uint64_t upper:2;   /* Normally 2 for XKPHYS */
00089         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13; /* Must be zero */
00090         uint64_t io:1;  /* 1 for IO space access */
00091         uint64_t did:5; /* PCIe DID = 3 */
00092         uint64_t subdid:3;  /* PCIe SubDID = 1 */
00093         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;  /* Must be zero */
00094         uint64_t node:2;        /* Numa node number */
00095         uint64_t es:2;  /* Endian swap = 1 */
00096         uint64_t port:2;    /* PCIe port 0,1 */
00097         uint64_t reserved_29_31:3;  /* Must be zero */
00098         uint64_t ty:1;  /* Selects the type of the configuration request (0 = type 0, 1 = type 1). */
00099         uint64_t bus:8; /* Target bus number sent in the ID in the request. */
00100         uint64_t dev:5; /* Target device number sent in the ID in the request. Note that Dev must be
00101                    zero for type 0 configuration requests. */
00102         uint64_t func:3;    /* Target function number sent in the ID in the request. */
00103         uint64_t reg:12;    /* Selects a register in the configuration space of the target. */
00104     } config;
00105     struct {
00106         uint64_t upper:2;   /* Normally 2 for XKPHYS */
00107         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13; /* Must be zero */
00108         uint64_t io:1;  /* 1 for IO space access */
00109         uint64_t did:5; /* PCIe DID = 3 */
00110         uint64_t subdid:3;  /* PCIe SubDID = 2 */
00111         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;  /* Must be zero */
00112         uint64_t node:2;        /* Numa node number */
00113         uint64_t es:2;  /* Endian swap = 1 */
00114         uint64_t port:2;    /* PCIe port 0,1 */
00115         uint64_t address:32;    /* PCIe IO address */
00116     } io;
00117     struct {
00118         uint64_t upper:2;   /* Normally 2 for XKPHYS */
00119         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13; /* Must be zero */
00120         uint64_t io:1;  /* 1 for IO space access */
00121         uint64_t did:5; /* PCIe DID = 3 */
00122         uint64_t subdid:3;  /* PCIe SubDID = 3-6 */
00123         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;  /* Must be zero */
00124         uint64_t node:2;        /* Numa node number */
00125         uint64_t address:36;    /* PCIe Mem address */
00126     } mem;
00127 #else
00128     struct {
00129         uint64_t reg:12;
00130         uint64_t func:3;
00131         uint64_t dev:5;
00132         uint64_t bus:8;
00133         uint64_t ty:1;
00134         uint64_t reserved_29_31:3;
00135         uint64_t port:2;
00136         uint64_t es:2;
00137         uint64_t node:2;
00138         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;
00139         uint64_t subdid:3;
00140         uint64_t did:5;
00141         uint64_t io:1;
00142         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13;
00143         uint64_t upper:2;
00144     } config;
00145     struct {
00146         uint64_t address:32;
00147         uint64_t port:2;
00148         uint64_t es:2;
00149         uint64_t node:2;
00150         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;
00151         uint64_t subdid:3;
00152         uint64_t did:5;
00153         uint64_t io:1;
00154         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13;
00155         uint64_t upper:2;
00156     } io;
00157     struct {
00158         uint64_t address:36;
00159         uint64_t node:2;
00160         uint64_t reserved_38_39:2;
00161         uint64_t subdid:3;
00162         uint64_t did:5;
00163         uint64_t io:1;
00164         uint64_t reserved_49_61:13;
00165         uint64_t upper:2;
00166     } mem;
00167 #endif
00168 } cvmx_pcie_address_t;
00169 
00170 /**
00171  * Return the Core virtual base address for PCIe IO access. IOs are
00172  * read/written as an offset from this address.
00173  *
00174  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the IO is for
00175  *
00176  * @return 64bit Octeon IO base address for read/write
00177  */
00178 uint64_t cvmx_pcie_get_io_base_address(int pcie_port);
00179 
00180 /**
00181  * Size of the IO address region returned at address
00182  * cvmx_pcie_get_io_base_address()
00183  *
00184  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the IO is for
00185  *
00186  * @return Size of the IO window
00187  */
00188 uint64_t cvmx_pcie_get_io_size(int pcie_port);
00189 
00190 /**
00191  * Return the Core virtual base address for PCIe MEM access. Memory is
00192  * read/written as an offset from this address.
00193  *
00194  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the IO is for
00195  *
00196  * @return 64bit Octeon IO base address for read/write
00197  */
00198 uint64_t cvmx_pcie_get_mem_base_address(int pcie_port);
00199 
00200 /**
00201  * Size of the Mem address region returned at address
00202  * cvmx_pcie_get_mem_base_address()
00203  *
00204  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the IO is for
00205  *
00206  * @return Size of the Mem window
00207  */
00208 uint64_t cvmx_pcie_get_mem_size(int pcie_port);
00209 
00210 /**
00211  * Initialize a PCIe port for use in host(RC) mode. It doesn't enumerate the bus.
00212  *
00213  * @param pcie_port PCIe port to initialize
00214  *
00215  * @return Zero on success
00216  */
00217 int cvmx_pcie_rc_initialize(int pcie_port);
00218 
00219 /**
00220  * Shutdown a PCIe port and put it in reset
00221  *
00222  * @param pcie_port PCIe port to shutdown
00223  *
00224  * @return Zero on success
00225  */
00226 int cvmx_pcie_rc_shutdown(int pcie_port);
00227 
00228 /**
00229  * Read 8bits from a Device's config space
00230  *
00231  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00232  * @param bus       Sub bus
00233  * @param dev       Device ID
00234  * @param fn        Device sub function
00235  * @param reg       Register to access
00236  *
00237  * @return Result of the read
00238  */
00239 uint8_t cvmx_pcie_config_read8(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg);
00240 
00241 /**
00242  * Read 16bits from a Device's config space
00243  *
00244  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00245  * @param bus       Sub bus
00246  * @param dev       Device ID
00247  * @param fn        Device sub function
00248  * @param reg       Register to access
00249  *
00250  * @return Result of the read
00251  */
00252 uint16_t cvmx_pcie_config_read16(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg);
00253 
00254 /**
00255  * Read 32bits from a Device's config space
00256  *
00257  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00258  * @param bus       Sub bus
00259  * @param dev       Device ID
00260  * @param fn        Device sub function
00261  * @param reg       Register to access
00262  *
00263  * @return Result of the read
00264  */
00265 uint32_t cvmx_pcie_config_read32(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg);
00266 
00267 /**
00268  * Write 8bits to a Device's config space
00269  *
00270  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00271  * @param bus       Sub bus
00272  * @param dev       Device ID
00273  * @param fn        Device sub function
00274  * @param reg       Register to access
00275  * @param val       Value to write
00276  */
00277 void cvmx_pcie_config_write8(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg, uint8_t val);
00278 
00279 /**
00280  * Write 16bits to a Device's config space
00281  *
00282  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00283  * @param bus       Sub bus
00284  * @param dev       Device ID
00285  * @param fn        Device sub function
00286  * @param reg       Register to access
00287  * @param val       Value to write
00288  */
00289 void cvmx_pcie_config_write16(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg, uint16_t val);
00290 
00291 /**
00292  * Write 32bits to a Device's config space
00293  *
00294  * @param pcie_port PCIe port the device is on
00295  * @param bus       Sub bus
00296  * @param dev       Device ID
00297  * @param fn        Device sub function
00298  * @param reg       Register to access
00299  * @param val       Value to write
00300  */
00301 void cvmx_pcie_config_write32(int pcie_port, int bus, int dev, int fn, int reg, uint32_t val);
00302 
00303 /**
00304  * Read a PCIe config space register indirectly. This is used for
00305  * registers of the form PCIEEP_CFG??? and PCIERC?_CFG???.
00306  *
00307  * @param pcie_port  PCIe port to read from
00308  * @param cfg_offset Address to read
00309  *
00310  * @return Value read
00311  */
00312 uint32_t cvmx_pcie_cfgx_read(int pcie_port, uint32_t cfg_offset);
00313 uint32_t cvmx_pcie_cfgx_read_node(int node, int pcie_port, uint32_t cfg_offset);
00314 
00315 /**
00316  * Write a PCIe config space register indirectly. This is used for
00317  * registers of the form PCIEEP_CFG??? and PCIERC?_CFG???.
00318  *
00319  * @param pcie_port  PCIe port to write to
00320  * @param cfg_offset Address to write
00321  * @param val        Value to write
00322  */
00323 void cvmx_pcie_cfgx_write(int pcie_port, uint32_t cfg_offset, uint32_t val);
00324 void cvmx_pcie_cfgx_write_node(int node, int pcie_port, uint32_t cfg_offset, uint32_t val);
00325 
00326 /**
00327  * Write a 32bit value to the Octeon NPEI register space
00328  *
00329  * @param address Address to write to
00330  * @param val     Value to write
00331  */
00332 static inline void cvmx_pcie_npei_write32(uint64_t address, uint32_t val)
00333 {
00334     cvmx_write64_uint32(address ^ 4, val);
00335     cvmx_read64_uint32(address ^ 4);
00336 }
00337 
00338 /**
00339  * Read a 32bit value from the Octeon NPEI register space
00340  *
00341  * @param address Address to read
00342  * @return The result
00343  */ static inline uint32_t cvmx_pcie_npei_read32(uint64_t address)
00344 {
00345     return cvmx_read64_uint32(address ^ 4);
00346 }
00347 
00348 /**
00349  * Initialize a PCIe port for use in target(EP) mode.
00350  *
00351  * @param pcie_port PCIe port to initialize
00352  *
00353  * @return Zero on success
00354  */
00355 int cvmx_pcie_ep_initialize(int pcie_port);
00356 
00357 /**
00358  * Wait for posted PCIe read/writes to reach the other side of
00359  * the internal PCIe switch. This will insure that core
00360  * read/writes are posted before anything after this function
00361  * is called. This may be necessary when writing to memory that
00362  * will later be read using the DMA/PKT engines.
00363  *
00364  * @param pcie_port PCIe port to wait for
00365  */
00366 void cvmx_pcie_wait_for_pending(int pcie_port);
00367 
00368 /**
00369  * Returns if a PCIe port is in host or target mode.
00370  *
00371  * @param pcie_port PCIe port number (PEM number)
00372  *
00373  * @return 0 if PCIe port is in target mode, !0 if in host mode.
00374  */
00375 int cvmx_pcie_is_host_mode(int pcie_port);
